results.hypothesis: H1: Import pressure predicts variant arrival timing
results.metric: Average correlation (import pressure vs arrival rank)

details.interpretation: Negative correlation means higher import pressure associates with earlier variant arrival (lower rank = earlier)

results.hypothesis: H2: Risk score predicts wastewater surge

details.interpretation: Model predicts direction correctly 50.0% of time. RMSE 20.34 vs baseline 13.72 (worse than naive)

results.hypothesis: H3: High import pressure = faster propagation
results.metric: Median days difference (high vs low pressure)

details.interpretation: High-pressure locations took median 108 days to 50% prevalence vs 84 days for low-pressure locations
Model provided 53 days median advance warning for 33/50 locations (66%)

recommendations: Consider adding more granular flight data (actual passenger counts) or incorporating layover/connection flight patterns
Risk score formula may need recalibration. Consider adding: seasonality factors, population immunity estimates, or variant-specific transmissibility
Propagation speed analysis inconclusive. May need longer time series or more locations with complete sequencing data
